body.p: “[$FriendName$],” he says, “yeah I like the sound of that. I think I’m a [$FriendName$].”
“OK then. How long have you been here, [$FriendName$]?”
“As long as I can remember,” he says. “I don’t know what I’m doing here, but I know I need to get out. Can you help me?”
“I don’t know. I’ll try.” You look around the room. There are two doors, the one you entered through and another one. But neither one opens when you approach.

Then you notice something else: In the middle of the room is a slightly raised platform. Cautiously, you step onto it and it clicks down beneath your weight. Immediately, the far door slides open. Outside you see – sunlight! It looks like the door opens onto a clearing in a forest. You walk toward the door, but the moment you step off the platform, the door slides shut again.
You realize your dilemma: the only way to open the door is to stand on the platform, but if you’re standing on the platform, there’s no way to get through the door. It’s a perfect trap.
Except… there are two of you. If you stand on the platform, [$FriendName$] can escape through the open door. And if [$FriendName$] stands on the platform, you can escape.

div.data-value: Tell [$FriendName$] to stand on the platform so you can leave.
Stand on the platform and tell [$FriendName$] to leave.
